page.title: 02Hill farms
page.content: The land to the north of Haltwhistle rises steeply and most of the farms in our survey area are classed as hill farms. The stock kept are suckler cows which are specially bred to withstand harsh winter weather and herds of sheep which are kept out on the fell for most of the year. Haltwhistle is famous for its Blue-Grey cattle which are a cross between a White Shorthorn and a Galloway. There is an annual mart in the town at which they are sold. The main breeds of sheep kept are Scottish Blackface, Swaledale, Welsh Mountain and Herdwick, all very hardy sheep. The hill farmers are worried that they might be unable to feed their stock this winter as the continual rain this summer prevented many from harvesting any hay at all.
